name: dd_company_id
description: Id for the company within the Dreamdata system (Primary key)

name: all_domains
description: List of all domains associated with the company. This defines which anonymous events (events with only a company domain) are associated with the company.

name: account_owner

fields.name: email
fields.description: Account owner email address from primary CRM

fields.name: name
fields.description: Account owner name from primary CRM

description: Record containing info about the account owner in the primary CRM. Will be empty if company is not found in primary CRM.

name: properties

fields.name: created_date
fields.description: Date when the company record was created

fields.name: annual_revenue
fields.description: Binned annual revenue of the company.

fields.name: number_of_employees
fields.description: Binned number of employees at the company.

fields.name: is_from_primary_crm
fields.description: Flag indicating if the record originated from the primary CRM system

fields.name: is_anonymous_company
fields.description: Flag indicating if the company is anonymous. An anonymous company is one that is not from the primary CRM and does not have any contacts with a business email associated. Most company counts in the Dreamdata UI are make using is_anonymous_company = FALSE i.e. not including anonymous companies.

fields.name: engagement_score
fields.description: Engagement score for the company within the last 30 days (0-1). This value is automatically calculated by the Dreamdata platform based on the companyâ€™s activities within the last 30 days

description: Record containing company properties. The properties are combined from the different source integrations using waterfall enrichment prioritizing 1. The primary CRM 2. Other integrations including active intent providers 3. Dreamdata's proprietary AI enrichment and labeling.

name: custom_properties
description: Custom company properties in JSON format. These are the selected properties from the primary CRM. Which properties are included is controlled through the Dreamdata source UI

name: source_system

fields.name: id
fields.description: Id for the object record in the source system. This will not necessarily match the 'dd_' id, but is useful for locating records in the source systems directly

fields.name: source
fields.description: Name of the source system like hubspot, salesforce, etc.

fields.name: object
fields.description: The name of the object in the source system like companies, accounts, etc.

description: Array containing the source systems in which the company was found.

name: audiences

fields.name: dd_audience_id
fields.description: Id of the audience within the Dreamdata platform. This uniquely defines the audience

fields.name: created_date
fields.description: Date for the creation of the audience

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the audience given within the Dreamdata UI.

description: Array containing the audiences the company is part of. Audiences can be defined using the no-code audience builder in the Dreamdata UI and will be automatically updated.

name: row_checksum
description: Checksum for the row. If any value in the row changes, the checksum changes otherwise it is unchanged. This should only be used to setup incremental table updates.
